She loves her teachers and she comes home every day happy, safe and excited to return. What we love most is the amazing organization of the team, the high quality learning that occurs each day, the effective and regular communication, the bright clean learning spaces and the healthy meal options. As an educator myself, I couldn't be more pleased with Global Aware. Thank you to the entire team for their hard work and dedication. If you are thinking of a daycare option for your child in Summerside, don't look any further, this place is 100% worth it!

We are so grateful for the care our kids received while under the care at Lewis farms. All of the educators and director Sally, are kind and treat your kids with love and respect. Our kids have loved coming here and will miss it so much! Our kids have grown so much socially, and intellectually over the years.  We love that they provide all meals for your children so as a working parent you don't have to stress about packing lunches.  The menu is kid friendly, but healthy. Great communication through the himama app as well.

My son has attended Global Aware Lewis Farm for 2 years. He and my whole family love here! At Global Aware, my family is always warm welcomed by the teachers and the director. We are like a real family. And as a working mom, I really appreciate their breakfast, lunch and snack. I don't have to prepare or worry my son's diet. The menu's diversity and portion are also appropriate for my son. Thanks to each teacher's incredible care and the way of learning and growing, he is growing so well. Strongly recommend to other parents.

More than 5 star to all dedicated staff of GAC Lewis Farms! My daughter will soon transition to Kindergarten after almost 2 years with GAC and I can't help but feel so sad I wish they offer Kindergarten Program here. If you are looking for peace of mind, I highly recommend this center! Shoutout to Ms. Kristina, my daughter talks about you non-stop!Ms. Beth, Ms. Yolanda,Ms. Larina, Ms. Lili and to all other awesome teachers( sorry I cannot name all:)), thank you for all the love and patience! Ms. Zeny, thank you for your referral! We would have not found this place!Ms Sally, you are highly effective at what you do! We will miss you all!!Thank you for helping us raise our kids!:)May God richly bless you all!

It’s wonderful to see how our son quickly adjusted and got comfortable going at the daycare. My son has shown great development on his social and communication skills. We appreciate that his educators are really committed to providing a safe, fun, and loving environment and we are very thankful to the whole team at GAC – Lewis Farms. I highly recommend Global Aware Care to all parents!

Friendly and safe environment for kids, friendly and professional staffs in the center. Since my kid started with Global Aware Care Lewis Farms Daycare at the beginning, she had no problem to spend the day in the center. I referred this center to my friends, and they love it as well.

We cannot thank the team at Global Aware  enough for the amazing care that they have provided our daughter. Our daughter Ariana has learned so much from shapes, to animals, songs, dances, numbers, special events and celebrations and so on.  Just as importantly, the team truly made us feel like part of their family. Our daughter knows all the team members names and they always made our family feel welcome at pick up and drop off. We will truly miss seeing everyone on a daily basis and would highly recommend this daycare as a great place for your child. Thank you Global Aware! You were soo amazing!

Last year my son did the AM preschool, this year he's in full day daycare and really likes it. He was a little apprehensive at first, but they did such an amazing job being patient and making him comfortable. I have nothing but great things to say about the instructors, staff and admin. I really like the daily recaps because my son always just says he had a good day but never goes into detail lol

My daughter is in the full day Preschool at the Savaryn center and we love it. Teacher Minda is wonderful with my daughter and she always come home telling us how much fun she had. They do lots of activities and crafts and we love the nature based learning. I also love the proximity to MSS school, making the commute very easy. I also love the use of hi mama app, the photos and updated are thoroughly appreciated. The only improvement for me would be if they served hot lunches. I would definitely recommend this daycare.

All three of my girls have attended programming (either preschool, daycare, or both) here and we have loved every minute. The staff are amazing, caring, professional, and fun. The centres are clean, engaging, and inclusive. Most recently, the protocols they have implemented to ensure everyones safety throughout the pandemic are impressive. My older two were very well prepared for kindergarten upon graduation, and my youngest has already improved her speech and social skills. Thank you Global Aware

Global Aware Savaryn is such an amazing place. My son has been there for three months and we are amazed to see how he has grown over the time. Teachers presents education in a playful manner that creates a love for learning. My son always look forward to go to school in the morning and excited to see Miss Minda and Miss Michelle as they are very lovely and supportive. I would be glad if the centre provides healthy meal during lunch time like other preschool do. Overall, it’s an excellent place for kids.

I was attending this school for half a year and the teachers treated me badly, but I don’t know if the school changed or not since this happened at 2nd grade in the year 2014, I am guessing that it’s good now cause of the ratings
Amazing school! The staff and teachers are exceptional 👏
I went there for grades 1-4, awesome school and awesome teachers. Great for everyone!

I have a great-grandson attending this school for the second year.  I can't say enough about the incredible teachers I have met - home room with Mr. Algare has been a life saver for our little man.  Music/choir with Miss. Johnson - another great experience!  It's a friendly, welcoming school and I feel the warmth the minute I walk into the building.  Great work!!  Great place!

I love the school! I was there for many years all I can say is it’s starting to be a little bad some teacher’s  are rude like the 2nd grade teacher still scares me tell this day and the new music teacher dose not really teach anything just makes us watch something as they sit in there desk. And the principal acts really nice to parents but no as nice to kids.

PLEASE BEWARE . I up until recently had two of my children attended this "daycare". Back story I had I my boys enrolled in the "daycare" for about 3.5 years. The first, 2ish years were great my kids were happy, staff around was consistent. Communication with the workers was great.

There seem to be a change in management roughly a year ago. That's were things took a turn for the worst. My youngest (4) son in that time became so unhappy and frustrated that he was "lashing out" at the center. So i tried to work together with the current manager to come up with a plan she her self said the daycare was not up to standard. To rectify the situation a plan was made and improvements seem to be happening, well was I ever wrong.

The constant staff change with no follow through on the plan (there part) my son began to slip again. This time around the manager would become extremely rude on the phone and in person. She would call ordering us to pick up are son. Which we complied with. She would send a video of my son crying very distraught and upset like a video that would break your heart if it was your child. The puzzling factor was my son would not act like this at home.

3 days before I started back at school we recieved a termination letter from current manager. In hindsight it was the best/only good thing she did for my child.

Digging a little deeper we found out through staff and other kids. That my son was being bullied. He was being constantly singled out by some of the workers calling him a bad boy, and the staff would Tell the other children. Do not play with him as he is a bad kid. This is basic BULLYING

I was heartbroken I couldn't believe as a parent I failed my own child. I actually believed the manager (current). It turns out she did not have the best interest in my child. It made me sick to my stomach when I found all this out.

The number of infractions is actually incomprehensible. Some of the most basic things were violated. Having cleaning supplies under the toddler bathroom sink. Not enough staff supervision in rooms. You can actually look these up as they are available to the public.

Thankfully I have both my sons in a new daycare that actually cares for there well being. The amount of change in my youngest son since the new daycare is so much. I couldn't be happier. He is getting back to his old self finally.

It's funny how when we drive by the old daycare he gets scared, nervous and always ask me if he has to go to the old "daycare". I just turn to him and tell him he will never go back to that daycare. You can see how relieved he is when I tell him that.

Now, I know that she will respond and try to slander my review that is just how they roll at this "daycare". But thats a bully mentality.

Sincerely Kyle

I first rated this daycare a 5. That was before the new management.  Ever since then... Always new workers.  Have to steadily tell them what is expected for the care of my daughter. The boss seemed to be impatient more than a few times I dropped off an picked up my daughter. The last week she was there. She got steady diaper rashes, and a few times came home with a full pamper.

If you can find a better place, go for it. The owner seemed impatient and as a parent. I'd rather leave my kid with a peace of mind knowing that she is in a safe place with patient staff that pay attention.

This is a place that really prioritizes child care and letting a kid be a kid, explore and learn while still prioritizing safety. My 1 year old for the first 2 weeks was scared and sad but they did such a good job making him comfortable and making me comfortable now he has been there for a few months and he is always smiling and loves his daycare workers.
If a problem or question ever arose they addressed it promptly and the issue never arose again. This is a great place.

My son has been in the daycare for over a year now. There have been some staffing challenges but I don’t feel like the level of care has dropped at all. My son is learning new things every day. The staff, especially Miss Pampa, love my son. He even calls her mama sometimes. They have a very sweet relationship. I don’t have anything bad to say.

Great leadership of Miss Parul, Miss Daxa and Miss Ailane, their very humble and friendly to their staffs and everyone.

My children started attending this daycare last March and it’s amazing they loved it there. They also loved the food-it’s freshly made and nutritious. My son is not picky eater anymore. Their also training the children to be responsible individual and to have a good moral character. All staffs have genuinely love and care for children.

I have never seen Daycare like Great Expectations childcare, my son was in another Daycare and he was punished by teacher in Little people's Daycare every time when he saw me he was crying and he didn't want to go there ,since I put my child to this Daycare he is so happy and  he is so friendly with teacher and manager , this Daycare has the best owner, manager, and teachers. I am very happy to put my son here and I'm not worried about him. They have an app that parents can see what children did and also they send the photo of children to parents. Although there are limited registrations , because of them, children's comfort and access to toys are more important than money, suggest all dear mothers register their children here.thank you Ms Claudine and dear owner.

We are beyond grateful for the exceptional care and love our daughter receives at this Childcare. Ms. Claudine is an incredible leader who truly cares about each child's well-being and development. The staff is warm, attentive, and nurturing, creating a safe and stimulating environment for the little ones. Our daughter has blossomed here, and we have seen her confidence and social skills flourish. We trust this place wholeheartedly and highly recommend it to any parent looking for top-notch child care. Thank you, Ms. Nadia and Ms. Claudine, and the entire team, for making a positive impact on our daughter's early years!

Miss Claudine is a wonderful director, and the staff are nice. Although working here as a student, I wouldn’t recommend. The owner of the daycare withheld my government funding for my education and blocked me from contacting her, calling me a scammer. You won’t be appreciated for your hard work as you should be working in a daycare. Also just to add, I worked at this centre for the duration of my education (almost a year) and there wasn’t a single toy replaced or any new toys. Kids get bored.

We loved it here. Our kids love it too. I would always see the owner going into the building with bags of new books and activities. They were always open to criticism and really tried solving any problems we had. They would go for walks and had a lot for the kids to play with. We have since left their care only because they no longer were available to pick up our child from our lady of mount caramel school. We would go back in a heartbeat if they offered that service again.

I absolutely love this daycare. My son loves it and looks forward to going every day. He loves his teachers and friends. I’m impressed with how much my son has grown over the time he’s been there and I will always and forever recommend this daycare to my friends. Thank you Nadia for running a great daycare.

A wonderful daycare. I like the family atmosphere , wonderful staff who love and teach children. And when I saw that the director of the Uzma institution spends extra time with my child (he had adaptation), my heart became calm and I am sincerely glad that I chose them.

Our triplets have enjoyed Guardians Child Care since they were just over 2 years old. They are now over 3 and a half. They absolutely love their teachers and friends, the huge outdoor space, the yummy meals and snacks, and field trips!
A just heard a child was pintched for not napping so horrible

I cannot speak highly enough of Happy Dreamers daycare. As a concerned parent, I searched tirelessly for a daycare that would provide my child with the best care and nurturing environment possible. I am delighted to say that they have far exceeded all my expectations.
Homemade food, and their warm and welcoming atmosphere is highly appreciated. The outdoor play area is a child’s paradise, with ample space for exploration and physical activities.
They have an exceptional caring and a passionate staff.
I am eternally grateful to the entire team for taking care of my child.
Thank you.

My two daughters goes to happy dreamers daycare, the staff is beyond amazing! It is such an amazing daycare,  that loves and goes above and beyond for the children. Happy dreamers will make sure that your children will have the best experience to grow and learn and feel loved. Thank you to Vicky and shanyce for creating such an amazing daycare! ❤️

My son went to happy dreamers daycare for a year and half, it was the best experience my son ever had in his last 5 years. Unfortunately he is going to kinder this year and we have to move him because the school is quite far from the daycare. So I would like to take the opportunity to thank every and each member of this program for their friendly attitude welcoming atmosphere, positivity and professionalism, and  thank you Shanyce &Vicky for going above and beyond to meet everyone’s culture/ religions expectation, super clean organized and the home made meals are unbeatable.
My son loved his time is here and made lots of friends.
I highly recommend this daycare.
Thank you again for helping my boy grow and learn.

My daughter is going here and the child care workers are all very nice. My daughter’s teacher Meghan, Brianna, Emma are all very kind and loving. It was nerve racking to send baby who can’t speak to new environment but so far I am  satisfied. I can tell she is having great time there and being take cared. She always have happy face when I pick her up!
I can recommend this place to anyone :)

We love this daycare - everyone is so caring and professional with both the parents and the kids. Always feel safe dropping off our child and couldn’t ask for more in a daycare. They provide multiple activities for the kids with lots of check ins throughout the day with parents through an app. Highly recommend!

We have been using this daycare since July of this year and couldn’t be happier with the facility and the staff. Our little one loves it there and has maintained his happy personality since starting there.

We receive daily updates on his activities and the staff genuinely care about the children in their care. If you are looking for a place where you leave your child and have peace of mind, this is indeed a gem. I can’t say enough thank you’s to Miss Ruby and her staff❤️❤️

My son has been going here for a couple months now and the staff here have made his transition SO easy. You can see how much the staff love these children. My son gets excited now when dropping him off. I cannot say enough positive things about Harmony and the staff.

The owner is kind and patient. The facility is new with big bright windows. They have outdoor spaces for infants and for toddlers with turf (artificial grass areas) that are soft, clean, and new. My toddler has been there for a week and has enjoyed herself so far.
My children love it here. Everyone is wonderful!

Our experience with Harvest Pointe has been so positive and wonderful. The staff are all very caring, attentive, and friendly. It is clear that they have the well being of your children at heart. Unfortunately, we are moving and need to leave the center, but the educators and owners truly treat you like family. We always felt like our children were in great hands and the lines of communication were always open, allowing us to stay informed and involved in our children's development.  We will truly miss this daycare!

My 1 year old went to daycare here in 2022 and we had an amazing experience. The educators are so caring and attentive, I could really feel that they took the time to get to know my son and build a connection with him because he trusted them enough that he would go to them for cuddles. They also updated me after each day regarding how his day went, what he had for lunch, etc. The rooms are spacious, bright and minimalist with a Montessori feel which I love as I believe it fosters imagination. Their arts and activities also foster imagination and recycled materials. I appreciate that they take the kids outside for fresh air whenever the weather allows. It's also nice to be greeted by the co-directors at the front daily. We left the daycare because we had to move provinces but we have yet to find a daycare that we loved as much, Harvest Pointe Daycare set the bar high!

Hello…my experience with Harvest Pointe was tremendous! We moved to Alberta last year and after the first meeting, I knew it was the perfect fit to have my son be apart of their program! The directors and staff helped make our transition to our new place of residence so smooth! My son loved his teachers and his friends so much! Ive saw so many changes with my son for the 11 months he was in attendance there and I greatly appreciate it! Definitely recommended to have your little one join the daycare…Continue the great work and support and we miss you already! ❤️❤️

Our family had a fantastic experience at Harvest Pointe Daycare.  Our son attended for three years until we were moving and had to leave.  Harvest Pointe always felt like a second home for him.  The directors and staff are welcoming and friendly.  The lines of communication are always open and we felt well-informed.  Most importantly, we always felt that our son was in a safe, caring environment where he could grow and thrive.  We miss it already!

We recently enrolled our two year old daughter at Harvest Pointe Daycare could not be any happier! As first time parents, we were both somewhat anxious about leaving our child somewhere new but the daycare laid all of our anxiety ease as soon as our daughter started attending this daycare. This daycare itself is a clean, fun and cheerful facility with experienced, friendly and caring staff. I would highly recommend Harvest Pointe daycare to any parent looking for a quality daycare.

Looking to put my daughter in part time daycare, I called to make an appointment to bring my daughter by and see the Facility, have a tour, meet the staff hear about the programs and see how things operate. The facilitator invited me in with my daughter between 11-2pm but failed to specify that children would be napping between 12-2pm. She also didn’t communicate with her staff that I was coming so when I show up at the daycare for the orientation at 11am, no one was aware I was even suppose to be coming.
While I’m sitting in the room at lunch time asking questions and getting to know the staff and helping my daughter build some synergy with Children and get to know the facility before I decide to just leave her there.
The teacher who will to be watching my child brings her cell phone to me and says her boss wants to talk to me.
I am then told I can’t not stay at the daycare and I have to leave the daycare because of confidentiality. I didn’t understand why when I was trying to get my daughter familiar with the daycare. The director told me I wasn’t allowed to stay in the room with my daughter for longer the 10 minutes. I mentioned I have visited other daycares as well to get an idea of the program and not one of them has sent me away based off these policies. She then told me I should go with one of those other daycares then. I thought that was pretty rude and the whole experience was a waste of time and yes, potentially a break of confidentiality or whatever she stated because yah, I am being turned away and unwelcome there.

Based off the poor communication and disrespect that was given there I won’t be enrolling my daughter.

Honestly some of the most straight forward, hard working women that I've ever met. Almost every morning they see me with my little zoo (youngest is usually crying over attachments problems), greeting all three with "hello my beautiful baby!" And "oh I love you come here come here"

I believe they probably have their hands full BUT I'd recommend these girls to anybody looking for a team of staff who are warm hearted and delicately handle their business!

My 18 month old daughter has been in this daycare for a couple of months and we have been happy with the service we have received in the older infant room! The senior staff there and has been incredibly loving, warm, inviting and accommodating towards my daughter and her needs. There is a minimum ratio of 1:4, but there always 2 staff members and a maximum of 8 children in the room. The food smells great when I go and they have assured me it is all made on site and are all home style meals - my daughter is a picky eater at home and the feedback I get is that she eats really well there. I've gone to pick up my daughter at different times during the day and whether she's outdoors or indoors she seems to be happy and safe. She adjusted very quickly to the new environment and I give full credit to the staff there!
The admins (2 women) seemed really nice to me, too. They could be a little more professional with some of their paperwork (when I dropped off my deposit I did not get a receipt or anything and remember my name & number was written on a little piece of paper which made me a little nervous but they did hold our spot and everything turned out fine) but no place is perfect and I did not come across anything that was poorly done (from what I've seen anyway!) I do wish they had a website where they posted pictures and updates (private access to parents), but I get most of my feedback from the staff in my daughter's room anyway and they give me a daily report of how she did for the day when I pick her up (verbal, nothing written). I also wish they gave the parents a weekly menu of the meals they eat, I haven't asked for one so maybe I should!
The place itself is an older building but clean and the rooms have lots of natural light and kept tidy (again, I've dropped in at different times during the day). My daughter's been happy there and safe.

Wow, how bizarre. These two folks must have been at a different daycare! Both my kids go this daycare and we have had great experiences. Yes, the owners are a bit high and mighty, and by the way they are Romainian, not "polish or russian". However, the staff are lovely. They sincerely care about the children, and enjoy spending time with them. It is a safe and loving environment. The owners invest time and money to add special activities (music lessons, field trips, etc), that are above and beyond what is required of them. And they have the most wonderful cook who prepares meals from scratch daily. No daycare is perfect, but this a darn good one. And yes, please do check...they are accredited.

Well - I took all three complaints into consideration, sadly I have to agree with the majority. I met with one owner (Irna I think) and spoke with the other, they did seem to have that holier than tho persona. They discussed previous clients.... parents whose children previously went there-believing they were the ones that wrote these reviews- they discussed personal issues involving the children of these parents.

And there are some serious complaints against the daycare with licensing as reported.
As nice as the staff is and as good as the food smelt that day .....I would not want to deal with those ladies! Oh - they also own Mount pleasant....which they didnt tell me I found out on my own when calling around. Too bad the rooms were bright and the rest of the staff was very nice!

Our daughter attended this daycare for 4 years, and I can’t say enough good things about our experience with them. They employ such warm and welcoming staff, that I never hesitated leaving her in their care. Truly, they became her second  family, and I felt so relaxed knowing she was people that would care for her with such love and kindness. Sheri and Hans deserve a special mention, as my daughter spent over a year in the preschool room with them. They engage the kids, encourage them, and were great teachers of empathy and kindness.  We were so sad to say good bye, and even still my daughter talks fondly of them.

Helping Hands has a great outdoor play space. I welcomed how messy my daughter would come home, knowing she was playing in and exploring the outdoor space. The indoor space was always clean and well maintained.

We felt so lucky we found Helping Hands and can’t recommend it enough!
Our little one has been going to Helping Hands for almost a year now and it's like her second family. Great facility, excellent staff, owner actually cares. :)

We’ve had our son at Helping Hands for 2 years, and have loved it!  The teachers are all really wonderful and caring with the kids. The outdoor space is like none I have ever seen at a daycare- it is a full park with trees, a garden, play-sets, and lots of toys for the kids to enjoy. My little one never wants to leave when I pick him up from the park!  They let them play and get a little dirty outside… like kids should :).  Through the summer they also made weekly trips to a nearby spray park.
We made the mistake of attempting switching daycares to one slightly closer to home for the convenience, but we were back at Helping Hands after a week! We quickly realized just how amazing the care he was receiving at Helping Hands was, and we were wrong to assume it’d be the same at another daycare.
The owners obviously do a great job with hiring as the teachers are all fantastic, and there has been very little turnover in their staff.
I would recommend Helping Hands to anyone who is looking for a comfortable, laid back, and home-like experience for their children, with the security and reliability of an accredited daycare.
Provided meals are coming back soon too…woohoo!

My kids have attended this daycare for just over 1.5 years now and the daycare and staff have been excellent.
My kids tell me about their day with the teachers and fellow kids and it's clear that they are in a loving environment and enjoy their time there.
My emails are always responded to in a reasonable time frame. Helping hands did a great job managing through the pandemic.
This is a lovely environment for your kids and I would recommend this daycare wholeheartedly.

My daughter started going here when she was 18 months, and will have attended for almost a full year. Unfortunately we are moving and won't be able to continue attending here. The care my daughter receives here is amazing. I never worry about her there and I see first hand how loved she is by the staff. She has flourished here. Her language blossomed, she made friends and I always felt like she was well taken care of. The centre is safe, has an excellent outdoor area and is close to parks and spray parks that the staff take the children to. I was scared to put my child in daycare at the height of the pandemic, but Helping Hands was exceptional in every way and it made me feel good about my choice to send her there. Thank you Amanda, Hardeep and staff! You are lovely and we will miss you very much.

My daughter has been attending Heritage Daycare for 2 years now. She loves it and we love it too. The daycare is always very clean, the daycare providers are well trained, helpful and with a positive attitude towards the children. In the summer time they arrange a variety of field trips at super reasonable prices. The Director is always there! She communicates well to the parents either personally or by email. I can say the she is very diligent to accommodate the children needs, she makes sure to provide with super delicious meals, day plan and additional activities for the kids. I recommend the daycare 100%
Thank you Heritage Daycare !
My daughter has been attending this daycare since she was 5 months and doesn’t get sick (as expected with daycares). The staff are really great. It’s also very affordable and I love it here.

Heritage Daycare was not only the daycare for my daughter during the first 6 years of her life, it was her home! She was loved and cared by the staffs member. She made a really good friends, she learned a lot, she grew and she spent the most amazing time. The staffs are so flexible and professional, they love and care. My daughter still calls the Daycare: "My daycare" and time to time she asked me to take her to go for a visit. My wife and I could not make a better choice! We are really thankful for everything you guys did and still keep doing for other kids. Thank you...

My little guy has been going to this daycare for almost 3 years now. I moved from Toronto where he already attended a program for 6 months. The move and the change was initially very difficult for my son to accept. The daycare change also was tough on him. But the teachers at Heritage Daycare are so nice and accommodating. I still remember the first day I met the Director, Ms. Rajji. She is a friendly, understanding and accommodating women. She has a knack to make kids understand in the first go in the most amazing way. My little guy just loves her. All the teachers here are very helpful and have great activities for the kids. My son moved from the Babies group to the toddler group, to pre-kindergarten group and will soon move to the Kindergarten group and I am sure he is growing up great. The daycare facilities are hygienic, has good learning activities and the director makes sure to address and communicate your concerns always. I recommend this day care a 110%... :)

This daycare is the best. The staff are very loving, caring and they treat the children as their own. I highly recommend this daycare to everybody.

Excellent new facility. The place itself is clean, organized and up to the standards which any parents would aim at when looking for a safe place for their little ones. I am truly truly blessed and recommend this daycare to anyone. You will not regret it and your child will have the best  experience there. I see it on my son smile and I know I made the best decision bring him there.

Thursday, September 21 at 3:45-4 PM my boyfriend and I were walking near Ideal Daycare by Mill Woods Rd south and 62 Street. We noticed some toddlers (no older than 2/3) walking across the parking lot, unaccompanied. There were two of them and they were walking straight towards 62 street, obviously intent on running into the road. We stopped them when they got to the sidewalk and asked where their mommies were. They couldn’t talk very well yet, but we heard some kids playing in the playground behind the daycare. So we picked them up and carried them back. The caretakers there hadn’t even noticed these two little boys were missing. We returned them safely back.

I posted about this situation on Facebook because I felt this daycare would not report this incident to parents. I was right. The mother of one of these boys contacted me and informed me that they didn’t tell her what had happened. The day care then informed parents AFTER my Facebook post. They also stated they felt they didn’t need to report this to licensing.

If they are willing to hide this big of an incident, what else are they willing to hide?

Two young toddlers escaped their care last week and random passerbys found these children trying to cross 62st. This is a critical incident and the daycare failed to report to authorities after the children were returned, nor were the parents informed until days later… find the yeg reddit form for more details. Kids escape. It happens. But this daycares continued negligence proves they only care about themselves and not the kids. What else possibly goes on after parents leave their kids for the day?

Excellent and professional daycare! My children were never sick, bruised up or in need of dentists here. Children were cared for properly and staff showed respect to children and parents. Not a pleasant experience either. My child is less than a year old and did not receive good care and attention. There are 9 babies to 2 overwhelmed staff in the Infant/Toddler room.
